title: Block Blast!
description:
Enter the world of Block Blast, a fun and free block puzzle game where every move challenges your brain and strategy, rewarding you with satisfying crush effects as you blast cubes away. Whether you're seeking offline relaxation or looking to enhance your logic skills, Block Blast delivers an engaging puzzle experience.

üåü Why You'll Love Block Blast
üî∏ Vibrant Puzzle Adventure: Match colorful blocks on an 8x8 board, solve logic puzzles, and watch the cubes crush in a cascade of color.
üîπ Strategic Combos & Streaks: 
Use your brain to clear multiple lines of blocks in one move for powerful combos. Maintain your streaks to achieve massive scores!
üî∏ Casual Yet Challenging: Play at your own pace, relax your brain, or apply deep logic strategies to beat your highest score.
üîπ Offline Fun, No WiFi Needed: Enjoy free block puzzle game anytime and anywhere, perfect for endless fun on-the-go.

üí• Features of Block Blast
‚óè Puzzle Gameplay: Strategically place blocks and cubes, match colors, and solve each challenging level.
‚óè Adventure Mode: Take on progressively challenging puzzles, each level with unique theme jigsaw and visual styles.
‚óè Daily Challenges: Keep your brain sharp with daily logic puzzles and earn exclusive achievements.
‚óè Optimized for All Devices: Smooth, seamless gameplay experience with minimal memory usage‚Äîperfect for phones and tablets.

üéÆ How to Play
‚óè Drag & Match: Strategically place cubes on the 8x8 board.
‚óè Crush & Score: Complete rows or columns to crush blocks away and earn points.
‚óè Chase Combos: Plan your moves and trigger massive combos for bonus points.
‚óè Stay Strategic: Apply logic and strategy to prevent your board from filling up.

‚ú® Pro Tips for Puzzle Masters
‚óè Plan Ahead: Visualize your moves to keep the board open for larger cubes.
‚óè Maximize Combos: Match multiple rows and blocks simultaneously to boost your combos.
‚óè Master the Streak: Consistent clears will maintain your fun streaks and enhance your score rewards.

üî• Jump into the Free Block Puzzle Game!
Ready to test your brain, sharpen your logic, and enjoy hours of offline puzzle fun? Download Block Blast now and embark on an unforgettable block puzzle adventure.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a really solid game, ads aren't too frequent, and unlike every other mobile game it doesn't bombard you with a thousand popups asking you to pay $30 for their season pass or some in-game currency. My only complaint is that in the classic mode you can't pick which colors the pieces are. It changes automatically after you completely clear a board, and I just wish there was an option to pick specific colors/themes.

Good game, but spams an obscene amount of ads to the point it feels criminal. It feels like there's an ad every time you breathe. Lose a level? Ad. Lose a level and decline a revive? Ad DESPITE GETTING NOTHING. You win? Guess what, ANOTHER AD! This is genuinely absurd and I wish this was a crime. Do better, money hungry devs. Edit: To add onto this, it's specifically with the adventure mode. I don't entirely mind an ad after a long run of classic mode. Ads are annoying, but money has to be made.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for your honest feedback! We hear you about the ads and understand it can be frustrating. We're always working to balance the experience better, and your input really helps. Hope you'll stick with us as we keep improving! üôè

scraped_reviews.content: This is a pretty fun iteration of the block puzzle genre. Good sound effects and animations. I took a star away because, while I understand that ads are needed to pay the devs, the ads are not closeable or shippable, and it doesn't matter how long you watch the ads, they just go on forever; there's nothing to do but close the app and reopen it.

I want to like this game but after quite a few hours of gameplay I just can't. I spend more time watching games then I do playing. There's an ad after every action, ads if I win the round, ads if I lose a round. All I see are ads. 120 sec long ads, 4-5 stage ads where you have to click multiple times. So much time waiting for these to clear it's not fun anymore so I'm deleting. It feels like I'm playing a marketing campaign and not a good one at that.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your feedback. We're really sorry to hear that the ads are making the game less fun for you. We understand how frustrating that can be and will definitely look into balancing things better. We appreciate your input and hope to improve your experience in the future!

scraped_reviews.content: The games pretty good. I like to play it every time. It's just that there are so many ads and some of them are so unnecessary. Like there's this one time I was playing in adventure mode. I didn't have any space so I decided to take a revive and I did which costed an ad. I then put in a block and win, but then ANOTHER AD would just appear after I just got an ad. Overall the game is pretty good üëç

Aside from the constant ads, this game was fun. Until I updated it. Now, it's SO SLOW and the ads take even longer to show the close button. What used to be 30 seconds now take over a minute before the close button pops up and when I click on it, another part of the ad opens and I have to wait to see the close button again. I'm about to uninstall it just to avoid the constant, lengthy ads. I'll play other games instead of waiting to close out an ad that I didnt want to watch in the first place.

It's a great game, no pressure to clear a board. It's very relaxing until... The Ads. Guys, you really should add an ad-free option. It's unplayable at this point because, if I want to beat my high score, I have to watch ads to continue. It lasted 30 minutes when I decided it isn't worth it. I'd pay $2/month for this without ads. Ad-Free option, please.

Addictive but the ads are getting out of hand. When I first started playing this game I had loads of fun, easy to get addicted to, and I feel like they give you blocks you can actually use instead of one that is too big or something. The ads were minimal but it's gotten worse. During adventure mode, I get an ad every time I complete or fail a level. I had to wait one full minute to skip an ad, and most of the time I have to go to the playstore then switch back over just to keep playing.

unlike Tetres, you can not turn the piece to fit anyway you want. which annoyed me at first. However you adjust to the parameters and have to employ somewhat of a strategy to fit the 3 pieces to advance to the next level. so instead of 1000+ levels of increasing speed. There is calculated, deliberate moves similar to chess but on an ever-changing game play. Block Blast is just simply "ABlast" to play for hours on end. My family has to wait til my phone dies to talk to me!!

The game is fun and all, but ads literally destroy my ability to earn the "consecutive victory" achievements. I'll be playing, then an ad will pop up in the middle of the level. When I close out of the ad, I get told I've lost the level and my consecutive victory count is reset to zero. I don't want to play a game where outside interference resets my score and costs me an achievement...

Far too many adds. Far too long adds. Some adds are either inappropriate or just ai slop. Most of the time it forces you to open a webpage or go to the app store, either when the video ends, OR when you close it. It's also rigged on Android, as you don't start on an empty board. And sometimes your first turn is impossible. So you just had to watch a 3 minute add, only to get a rigged level, and watch another 3 minute add. There is a line between necessary for the app and a waste of time.

uses insane amount of data. I was playing in the car for about 10 minutes, before I checked and saw that 25% of my data was used up. even when there were no ads playing, the app still used around 10mb of data per second. if you have a low data plan, get rid of this app immediately. 10mb of data per second is insane. I don't know what caused such high data usage, but until they fix it, don't use this app.

Game is fun, but the ads are constant. Now they are popping up during game play, not even between levels or fails! And instead of a handy, quick way to exit them, they pop up the play store every single time. This simple app does NOT need constant ads, there's even one at the bottom of the puzzles the whole time! So, fun game if you want to spend half the time watching ads.

I like this game. however, I can only get a score of about 10-20,000. I recently transferred all my stuff to a new phone - samsung galaxy s22 ultra - and before I transferred my apps, this phone had the version of this app with the bombs, where your score goes up faster. I got a high score of over 100,000 with that version. but after I transferred my stuff from my samsung galaxy note 9, it caused it to be the same version. updates don't do anything for me.. update: finally have the latest ver!

This game was fun at first. But the ads are infuriating, one every level! If you play in airplane mode it's fine for a few levels but then they become impossible to win untill you turn off airplane mode and watch an ad to revive, I definitely noticed a change in the score needed when I did this. The perseverance achievment has no indication of when you unlock it and they gaps are massive inbetween each one, obviously a sad tactic to keep people playing a rigged game.

The game is so chill yall. I be playing it whenever I'm bored or I just dont have anything else to do. It helps you think making decisions cause yk, you gotta figure out where the blocks finna go. Super fun, I love it. and yeah, that's pretty much it. Yes there are ads, not as annoying as you think though. They only appear after like you ran out of space or you're trying to revive. Where it is annoying is the adventure mode, that's why I rarely play it, but I like the regular one.

I love this game!! There are only two downsides: It's addicting to the point that it could distract you from mandatory tasks (though, sometimes that's an upside ;3), but the adventures could be a little more challenging in my opinion. They start off making you think about your moves‚Äî which is good ‚Äî but when you get nearer and nearer to the goal, the blocks become more... supportive of you winning ‚Äî if that makes sense ‚Äî and it sort of ruins the purpose of the challenge. But still, amazing game!

this game has been completely destroyed by ads. I've had fun playing for at least a year but now it's just unplayable. you have ads that are too long and then when you wait till the end of them they still take you to the Play store. it's absolutely ridiculous. uninstalling. too bad, this was a good game. if they offered the ability to buy I would but there is no ability to buy it.

I like the game pretty good on its own. In my experience and opinion, there aren't too too many ads. There's only 1 after each play, which could go on for a while. My problem, as soo sooo many others have stated is starting with blocks on the screen. I wish I started with a clear board. The ads for this game are also misleading. They show a bunch of other game modes to play, but we only have three. Can we pleease have more game modes üôèüôèüôè

Block Blast had potential, but it‚Äôs completely ruined by the ridiculous amount of ads. You can‚Äôt play for more than a minute without being hit with a long, unskippable ad. It‚Äôs beyond frustrating the game is basically unplayable. I only lasted an hour, and the only reason I stuck around that long was because I wanted to see if it would eventually give me fewer ads. Spoiler it didn‚Äôt. The ads just kept coming, nonstop, ruining any chance of actually enjoying the gameplay.

REALLY GOODüíÖ!!!! I love this game üéÆ ‚ù§Ô∏è! There's an adventure mode and classic mode. Classic mode is where you just try to beat your high score. Adventure mode is where you have to try and beat the levels. You can also try and get all the medals in the game, the medals are where you complete milestones and you get awarded. And sometimes you can watch a 5 sec ad for you to revive. I honestly could stay up all night playing it. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

this game is okay, not necessarily worth the hype but it is free, it works, but the downsides is that the ads are so annoying and they 'block' me from playing. it works offline, yes, but when offline and limited or no data the game doesn't let you revive and when it does there is like 2 ads that are a minute long and feels like much more when you just wanna play a game. the ads are scams BTW, some of them can give viruses I think. overall the game is OK ig, but kinda disappointed.

I really like this game but there are too many ads. It's pretty insane how many ads it has and it feels like you can barely play. I would gladly pay for no ads but it doesn't have that option. The game also uses a ton of battery and heats up my phone which is weird since it's just a puzzle game. I would change my review if they fixed these things. Great game if you want to play for just a little bit. If longer, the ads are too much.

These ads are way too long and sometimes would glitch out to where you had to choose the app and reopen it, but i was OK with it. Ads would ruin after every short game, but I was ok with that. If I didn't want see it then I'd just play one game a day then just close the game when I saw an ad. But the thing that's making me uninstall this game is it would seems to conveniently lag out at the worst time so you'd place the block in a wrong part and lose the game. Very sneaky and dishonest.

Block blast is a fun and addictive game which is good for winding down and stimulating problem solving skills. My main issue with this app (especially the Android platform) is that the ads are extremely long and moderately invasive as they occur after every single game. The IOS version does not have this issue, the ads there are much shorter and therefore less invasive. No one wants to watch an ad over 30 seconds on a mobile game.

I loved this app until the latest update. There used to be very little ads, but now the games are even harder, so they can force non-stop ads. I used to average over 10,000 points, but now I can't even break 1,000 points, and there is an ad after ever loss. The games are now rigged for you to lose quickly and have to wait through a 60-second ad before playing again.

Fun and Addictive, but also pretty annoying how most of the time the game is just setting you up for failure. Like how you start off with a bunch of scattered blocks all over the board with some shapes that no matter where you put them you'll still lose? I really dont understand why the game does that. But other than that I find the game to be a very enjoyable experience.

I really do like this game and wanted to love it, but I just can't do it. Not only are there ads in between every game, they are like 3-5 minute ads. As if that's not annoying enough, ads pop up in the middle of the game that are also very long. If you spend 1 hour playing this game, you will be watching Ads for 45 minutes or more of that hour! Even for free, I'LL PASS! It's not worth it. I'll never spend more time watching ads than playing a game no matter how good it is!

I LOVE it. HOWEVER, I hate that there are soooooo many adds literally after every puzzle (completed or failed). I never pay for ads to be gone, but i would for this game. the only reason I am give three stars is because of the ads. Give an option to pay a small fee to have them removed and I'll gladly update.

Well, I gotta update my 2-star review. Block Blast added in 5 other games all in the same app, none of which have ads. There's still the Samsung issue of the game starting out with a significant amount of blocks before I begin, but I like that there's other things to play now, too.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Blaster! Thank you so much for your suggestion. We truly appreciate your input, as it helps us improve the game and make it more enjoyable for everyone. Rest assured, we're always working to bring the best experience to our players. Thanks again for your support! üòä

scraped_reviews.content: block blast is a very good game to play for people who like puzzles and challenges. as the levels go on, they proceed to get harder, giving you more of a challenge to face every time you play a new round and get used to it. the best thing about block blast is thet you can play it offline, so you can play it anywhere at any time. block blast also has no ads so you can play without distractions.

TBH,this game is great as I can focus on how to to blast some blocks.But the problem is that on Samsung,even if I have lives I still lose,in comparison to the IOS.The revive is just stupid most of the time, as on the next few moves i lose.Also the ads for some reason are not working.Just one more thing:just add more gamemodes!cuz ngl it gets sometimes boring to play the same gamemode.Very hard to decide how many stars but I put four as it is a great game but still needs improvements.its a gg :/

I really enjoy playing Block Blast‚Äîit's fun, addictive, and a great way to pass time. But I have one suggestion that I think would make a big difference: please add an option to save progress, like linking the game to an account or cloud backup. I'm planning to get a new phone soon, and I'm worried I'll lose all my progress. It would be awesome if we had a way to transfer our game data easily. That way, players can keep enjoying the game without starting over. Overall, ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê!

edit I came back to give it two stars because the game is virtually unplayable if you join adventure mode on an Android device not only is it a completely different game from playing on iOS but the game actively plays against you I just had a four game streak or after placing my first block on the board it let me know there were no spaces left. and couple that with the fact that there is an advertisement every single time you see the home screen. goodbye üëãüèæ

Entertaining but too many ads. I cannot play continuously when there are ads everywhere, some are even opening apps on its own as if it has more control than me. I'm so close to uninstalling it and considering other alternatives. Update: After the most recent update of this game, it became even worse. The ads pop out of nowhere and when I try to go back to where it left, it's just black. When I try to restart the game this keeps on happening. WORST IN-GAME ADS EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We sincerely apologize for your bad experience, as this was never our intention. Your feedback will guide us in making improvements, and we will strive to provide a better gaming experience for all players. Thank you for your support! üíï

scraped_reviews.content: Highly addictive but easy to stop and continue later right where you were. I don't see a paid option but that would be good to have,. The ads are quick sometimes, but sometimes they're really long, like when reviving mid game. That's the main reason I try to do it without "reviving". But it's awesome otherwise ..

This game is so addicting and at the same time frustrating ü§£, it keeps me awake and entertained trying to beat my highest score in classic. Though it would be more fun and interesting to play if you'll add the glowing effect on blocks (if you know what I mean) to android users. Nevertheless, it's good and addictive to play. And also, our class is literally full of block blast players, we even compete if who's gonna have the highest score!ü§£

I really really loved this game when it first came out. It had ads and they were annoying but tolerable. Recently, though, the ad situation has gotten out of control. The ads are so much longer, they are never ever of any interest, and you literally can't leave them without visiting Google Play. (and even then, it's often at least a minute or more)There is no premium option. Bummed to have to quit but I can't take how bad they've gotten and will uninstall.

pretty good game, with puzzles that make you think unlike tetris this game you cannot turn the blocks to fit so you have have to think strategly. the only reason I gave it 3 stars is due to the advertising starting off short which i could handle after failing a level. but eventually the adds got abit too long and that was the only annoying part of this game. otherwise I would give it 5 stars.

This is a fun game and just tricky enough to keep your interest. It's also bright and colourful and has a couple of options of play I understand ads are a part of any game these days but the Royal Kingdom ads that last for 2 minutes before an X shows up is ridiculous-yes I timed them! If these carry on,I might have to uninstall as they're sucking the joy out of the game

The game is fun up until the game intentionally screws you over; and it happens A LOT! Case and point. I just finished a revive, cleared 3 lines, and the next set of blocks were impossible to place. The most annoying thing is when you finish a round and the game says 'perfect' (which I assume means you placed the blocks in the best possible way) only to have that followed up with a round with no possible solution. What a joke, and waste of time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Blaster! In our level design, our goal is to provide players with a fun and challenging experience. Your feedback has made us realize that we still need to continue optimizing to find a better balance. If you have any other concerns, please feel free to contact us. Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: WONDERFUL GAME DUDE!!! Itcs so gd addicting and I just love it. Though there are ads, but it doesn't matter, because this game works offline as well. I get hooked to it and I can play it almost everywhere, anytime and just, not get tired of it at ALL. It's literally so cool to just sit around with your mates and discuss high scores and try to beat em. Great concept, great features, great graphics! GREAT GAME!!

It used to be amazing, but now it isn't as good. The adventure mode has normal blocks, but you can only play so long before you win the level. The classic game on the other hand, it starts with the board mostly full and gives you some weird shape that only fits in one place. Nothing like the ads I've seen. I might uninstall it and use a similar app.

I love this game. it's my favorite. but, lately there's been more ads than game. Literally, I play for 30 secs. and watch a minute ad. I can't even skip them. And It used to be I play 3 puzzles, then I watch an ad. now everytime I play one puzzle, I watch 2 ads. WTH? I understand you've gotta make a profit, but if this keeps up, im uninstalling.

It's a fun game, but after you get so far in each game, it's definitely stacked against you. It'll start giving you blocks that are impossible to use. As an example, if you need some flat horizontal blocks to fill in a space, it'll give you three giant square ones that you can't possibly use, so game over. It's just a little frustrating at times.

The game is overall a really good and addicting concept, but as of recently there's been a massive issue with the advertisements playing the game like crazy. As well as the game blatantly screwing you over and giving you pieces that you can't use, several times now I've had really high scores and then I'm giving pieces that I can't use anywhere and then the game automatically ends.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, we're sorry for any frustration. Our goal is to provide a fun, challenging environment without undue pressure. Your feedback is important, and we‚Äôll use it to make adjustments. Thank you for your understanding! üòäüåü

scraped_reviews.content: This game is nice but there's just this one problem. I was gonna almost reach my highest score but I missed, normal as usually. There is an option where you watch an ad to continue playing, but whenever I click it, it says that there's no ads whatever and after that there's LITERALLY an AD SHOWED UP, AND AFTER THE AD ITS GAME OVER.. it always happens to me even when my wifi is stable. Please fix it.

update 5/2025 - changing rating to one. They started putting ads DURING levels, which take less than three minutes to complete.There was a pop-up still ad after completing a single line over and over. original: I love this game. But I am not getting the updates. It says it's updated, but the store page is showing events I don't have. My adventure path has been the cat for months. Others have posted similar things about not having the ability to update. *fixed previous issue with a reinstall!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Player, we apologize for the issues you experienced in the game. Rest assured, our team is addressing these problems and will strive to enhance your experience. Thank you for your patience and support during this time. üí™

scraped_reviews.content: This game could be a lot more fun, if I was able to start with a play area completely free of blocks and cubes. I'm always starting behind, and trying to clear the screen, and it's damn frustrating. No other game I have played, that counts as a puzzle game, starts out with anywhere from a quarter to half of the play area filled up already. Not cool.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Your valuable input has been shared with the development team, providing crucial direction and motivation for optimizing the game. We will keep striving to improve, and we truly appreciate your support!

scraped_reviews.content: Devs have no idea how to design a game. There have been at least 3 major overhauls of the core scoring system since I started playing. The current version feels like an early alpha build of the previous one. Scoring keeps changing, resulting in high-scores being utterly meaningless. Overall could be fun if/ when the devs figure out what they even want the game to be.

title: Navigation Pro: Maps on Watch
description:
Displays Google Navigation instructions from the phone on your Samsung watch. Great for driving, cycling and public transport.
Features autostart with navigation, voice output, customizable vibration, 102 languages, options for themes, speedometer and much more!
It requires the free companion app "Navigation Pro" from Samsung Galaxy Apps.

How to use:
- Install Samsung Gear and connect with your Gear smartwatch.
- Install this "Navigation Pro" app on your watch.
- Install "Navigation Pro" app from Google Play on your phone. 
- Start "Navigation Pro" app on your phone.
- Allow the app to read notifications. (Go to: Settings > Security > Notification Access and enable Navigation Pro). 
- Start Google Maps Navigation and instructions will be pushed to your smartwatch.

Troubleshooting
- Ensure your Gear watch is connected to Phone and you have "Galaxy Wearable" installed.
- If the app still only shows the "Ready" message, please ensure that maps notifications are activated and displayed on your phone (Go to: Settings > Apps > Maps and enable "Show notifications").
- Restart smartphone AND Gear watch
- Uninstall from phone, restart phone and reinstall the app
- If you have a Xiaomi phone, go to Security -> Permissions -> Autostart and activate "Gear Navigation"

The Wear OS app is not standalone and requires phone interaction in order to function.

Compatible with all Galaxy Watch models, Gear S2 / S3 / Sport, Gear 1, Gear 2, Gear S.
For Gear Fit2 (Pro) use the following app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=smartwatchstudios.app.gearfit20navigation

summary: Navigate with your watch and keep the phone in your pocket!

scraped_reviews.content: The App is outstanding. For those of you thinking that the app doesn't work on your new Active 2, it's because you didn't go through and set all the settings correctly. If you can't figure things out from the instructions on this page or the app itself, then a simple Google Search will show you what you need to do, and there are a ton of settings not enabled that need to be to work properly, but once setup, it is amazing. I suggest having the always on top feature enabled by default in the installer, because why would you start directions and not want it to be the top thing you see on your phone without having to dig through to the NP app and start it manually?

Works great. I started using it a couple years ago, and it was a little unreliable when put into background mode. Either through improvements in the app and/or Android, it's rock solid now (mid 2023). Setup can potentially be a pain, but my experience was straightforward and only took a few minutes of making sure the proper permissions were granted on the phone and watch.

This app is a complete let down. Takes forever (up to 10 minutes) to connect to the phone and constantly freezes. This is in turn destroys the battery life of your watch. Occasionally it just compleatly freezes your watch and you have to restart just to operate. Additionally it is basically useless, as the navigation is only accurate while the GPS App is open and on the main screen of the phone. Unable to use while driving or even just walking around the city with any kind of accuracy.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This behaviour is often caused by energy saving settings or taskkiller apps. Please look into these settings and disable any power saving apps to find out if they are the reason. Also, please open "Navigation Pro" on your phone, go to settings and exclude the app from power saving. You may also contact me directly through the email link in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: The app works but has a few flaws that make it unreliable. The watch vibration signaling an upcoming turn happens way to late to be useful. If you navigate to any other application or home screen on your watch the app will no longer alert you at all. When I finish with a different app, it should revert back to GPS automatically if the GPS is still in use on my phone. It should also have the option to turn the screen off in between notifications. There's no reason for my screen to be on my entire trip. It kills the battery way to fast. Please allow me to turn my screen off, not just dim it. Not worth the 2 dollars.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Justin, when you put the app in the background on your watch you probably don't want to use it. That's why it does not vibrate then or pop up by itself. It is a good idea to let the screen turn off between turns. However, the app would be closed then by the watch. You can open the app on your phone, go to settings and tick "Dim watch display".

scraped_reviews.content: Much more useful and convenient than I originally thought it would be. The only thing I'm not crazy about is how the navigation starts automatically on my watch when navigating with my phone in a vehicle (but I'm also not sure I can't change that). Otherwise, this is one of the few apps I added to the family library after purchasing to share with my immediate family. Definitely worth purchasing, no question. Edit: In the Advanced settings, watch navigation is easily disabled in vehicles!

This is worth paying for! I usually drive and even though sometimes there is another person with me on the car telling me directions, it's so confusing and I missed turns because the other person told me to turn early or later, this app helps me immensely whenever I travel. I can drive safely while also know where and when I need to turn. I don't know if it's possible but a suggestion to make the app even better is perhaps allow us to use S voice on Gear to set destination or add route?

Exactly what I was looking for with my smartwatch. I wanted something so I didn't have to have my phone on for long trips and could get real time directions on my watch and it does that. It even vibrates on your wrist when you get close to your turn/exit. I was a little hesitant to pay for an app (I generally don't buy any apps), but this one was a fantastic purchase that helps me our every time I need it.

this used to work great, now it keeps timing out on watch. I love in CT and when I'm using it it's twisty roads, narrow shoulders, tight traffic with bad drivers. I need the watch face to always stay on no matter what, and some update has stopped this. I've tried a bunch of recommendations on line, which the fact that there are a bunch of recommendations to fix this should tell you that someone messed up. please fix this

So you first install the "free" app, only then you are told it needs a partner app on your phone, which turns out is not free. Not very elegant. Either make the watch app paid, or notify me up front about the costs. In use: when I'm using it concurrently with the biking app, the latter will occasionally take the screen to show average speed etc. The navigation does not come back after that, not even when it's time for a new direction. Does not stop when arrived, draining battery.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: For use concurrently with the biking app, activate the option "always on top" for the navigation to stay on top of other apps. If you want the app to close after arrival activate "Close watch app after navigation" in the settings on Navigation pro on your phone. When I released the app it was not possible to make apps in the watch app store paid.

scraped_reviews.content: It actually works. I know that's a low bar but, lots of apps for the watch charge you and don't, there's no refund. (From the watch app store) This is great didn't need to pay for the watch app, then tried the phone app, it worked so I kept it. If it didn't then before 15 minutes I could in install and get a refund. So no loss. Galaxy Watch + Note 8 üëç Love the app, I've used maps a lot more because my watch gives me directions discreetly. Much easier to glance at my watch while driving or keep my phone in my back pack while cycling.
Since day number 1 it's still rocking! ai have suggested this to friends and family and all are satisfied

Pathetic. Had been using navigation wear free version which was decent. Thought navigation pro will be better, they don't have trial/free version you have to buy and I did that. Now repenting. The app just failed to connect with mobile. And it made my galaxy s21 ultra crash, the first app to make this power machine crash. Kudos to the developer. Update: Reinstalled, power saving mode off, battery was not optimized but it still didn't work. But thanks to the developer to initiate the refund.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Manish, has the app worked before? If so, Please uninstall 'Navigation Pro' from your phone, restart it (important) and install the app again. Also using power saving mode on your phone could cause the issue. If the problem persists you may contact us directly through the email link in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: Downloaded this app today and was delighted at how it gives me the information I really need to navigate in super large display. Installation was a snap. I guess if there was anything I could ask for it's the speed limit in the small font, rather than current time.

Indispensable app. But you must change settings related to this app and Google Maps going to sleep in the background. Crucially on Samsung phones, go into the power saving menu and do not select a power saving mode. Also turn off 'Adaptive Power Saving'. (You can always turn it back on when not using Navigation Pro). It then works flawlessly. I especially recommend having music through BT buds and G Maps voice guidance for the turns for an awesome experience. 5 Stars. Thank you.

Easy to use minimalistic navigation app. Easy to read and fairly accurate distance measurements. The only reason its not 5 stars is, I have trouble playing music when its open. Everytime my phone reads out the next turn when i have music playing the watch app turns off and my music stops. Doesnt happen when I don't use the watch app.

Overall this is a very handy app, though I think my biggest issue is the fact that it keeps the screen on; I think it should light up for notifications or when you turn your wrist, like the normal watch face.  Also if only it could show you a display of the map, but obviously that's a limitation of the watch itself. But in any case, this app is probably the best you're going to get on a Galaxy Watch.

Excellent app, does what it's suppose to. Love the rotation of the app. Two Isssues. 1) The voice could sound better..maybe add different voice options, and speech speed?...It also makes a poping noise when initiating the voice. 2) Every 12 seconds the Navigation screen flashes on/off . Dim settings don't work either, stays on bright. Watch won't go to sleep either. I'd like to be able to flip wrist and the Navigation screen come back on, but go back off when not looking. "Galaxy S3 Frontier".

The watch app keeps telling me to enable notifications, which I have already done. It also keeps disconnecting from the phone. I would love to be able to use this app but so far I have not had much luck. I was also not refunded the amount that I paid for the app even though it's been stated several times that there is an automatic refund for this purchase at the moment. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This is usually caused by energy saving settings. Please look into these settings and disable any power saving mode to find out if they are the reason. Also, open 'Navigation Pro' on your phone, go to settings and exclude the app from power saving. We're happy to assist further or refund you if you contact us through the email link in the app

scraped_reviews.content: Great app. I did have an issue with my phone (Note8+Gear S3) GPS not working properly if auto run was NOT turned on. It would route, lose GPS connection and i would have to back out of the route and start again and then it works without dropping. This is while having NavigationPro installed, but not set to autolaunch with maps. Once I turned on the autorun on NavigationPro app gps signal wasnt dropped when the watch app loaded.

I'd like to give 5 stars, but feel it needs a little more refinement, but for what it costs, it is MORE than worth it. I'd recommend it 100%. So handy alot of times. I have not experienced most of the glitches I've read about. More customization would be nice, voices etc. Once in a while it won't speak directions and a simple 1min reboot of the active2 fixes. Could be a phone/car Bluetooth issue.

I found this app (with the companion watch app) very useful especially when cycling as I just glance at the watch for the next turn with the street name plus it has different vibrations for a left or right turn and optional voice output. It's one of the apps that made the watch more useful. One small bug is that it starts on every occasion that Android Auto starts when I turn on my car but otherwise has been very reliable. The small cost is very reasonable & better than making it free with ads.

I bought the latest Galaxy watch largely for GPS options, as a motorcycle rider with mounted options not being ideal. After trying HERE WeGo, which uses the watch's GPS and thus is useless for quick GPS position and stability, I'd written off GPS as a viable option. Until this app, which utilises Phone GPS and relays to the watch through App pairing and Bluetooth. After sorting out notifications the App works flawlessly. It's a clear UI with great options. Fast, accurate, extremely useful. 10/10

App was mostly useful however had a few problems. It doesn't link to the watch and display anything when you have another navigation app open and also when you have Spotify playing. I also found it useless for walking if your journey included both the tube/train/subway AND walking. The walking instructions were very generic. Works great for just walking with no music

Setting up all of the permissions on my phone and watch were a little frustrating, but once set up it works as advertised, nothing more, nothing less. I wish it worked with waze, and I do prefer the crowd sourcing they use, but having directions right on my wrist on the steering wheel is worth it.

Works well. I feel like there's some shortcomings of the Samsung watch that the developer is able to overcome. For example, the ability for the screen to turn off in between turns, or the ability to go to a different screen on the watch and then go back to directions. Again think this is a limitation of the watch itself. This app is one of the few things that makes the watch useful.

I tried to download the app, but a message appeared and said I couldn't download it due to connectivity issues but it charged me anyway. I was able to get my refund, but now I cant download the app at all. Extremely disappointed after paying so much money for a watch and it doesn't even have a maps feature, but when I cave in and want to purchase the app, they refuse to let me download it. Unbelievable.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for getting in touch. Since you got refunded automatically I'd recommend to try the download again. Also, if you contact us directly through info@smartwatchstudios.com we can be more effective at helping you

scraped_reviews.content: Edit: I was contacted by the developer within a few hours. He had noted my problems and is working on a fix for my particular issue. Can't fault a developer for service like that. Can't wait for it to be adjusted, other than the issue with my car, this app worked as advertised. Samsung Galaxy S8+/ Samsung Galaxy Watch. App appeared to work fine until I got into my 2019 Kia. Once the phone paired with the car the watch app would not function at all. Even though paired and connected, the phone would not work with the car at all. I could not make calls or access my contacts through the Kia interface. I tried deleting phone from watch and car and re-pairing both. Same result. As soon as I uninstalled the phone portion of the app, the phone again worked with the car- the watch lived peacefully with the phone and the car. As soon as I re-installed the app, the system was broken again. Developer working on a fix.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi J, sorry for the connection problems with your kia. That's a special case I can't easily test. For a refund I need your GMail address, so please contact me through info@smartwatchstudios.com

scraped_reviews.content: What was great about the app is that my car navigation went out while driving so put on Google map for directions but I didn't have those car mounts for the phone. Next thing I see my watch is showing me the same route google maps. It surprised me because at the time I wasn't sure what the navigation software did. So I had a hundred miles left watching the route on my watch was awesome. The watch would buzz notifications to alert that you're half mile away from your exit. To be honest I love it

This app has worked flawlessly for me since the day I got it several months ago. The only reason it isn't five stars average is because of the idiots who insist on leaving 1 star reviews simply because they didn't read the description. Pay the few dollars or whatever it might cost for the watch / phone companion apps and you should be rockin and rollin

Just Brilliant, works really well both walking and driving. I especially like the fact it beeps as your coming to a junction or turn off. This has saved me on many occasions, when your driving on the motorway its so easy to miss a turning as you can always be detracted. Would not be without it and its ¬£3 to buy, well worth the investment üëç

Unacceptable for a $4 paid app! The option to show 'show speed' doesn't work even after multiple updates on big fixes supposedly regarding the same issue, when paired on the latest galaxy smartwatch and a year old flagship galaxy phone. Edit: I thought I didn't have to mention this, but I tried every possible combination of settings, with location access allowed all the time to opening the app on the phone and running in the background.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, I'm sorry you had trouble with the speed display. it should be because the app is not allowed to access GPS speed. Please open Navigation Pro on your phone and go to settings. Untick and tick again the box next to speed. When it asks for permission select "always allow". If it still doesn't work contact me through the email link in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: I have to give only 3 stars because of two things. The biggest is that it will not allow me to enable show speed, I click on. It it moves the slider than shuts it off instantly. The other is if you back out on the watch to look at a notification like a message then when you return instead of giving street info it's just ..... until I go onto a different street. If these would be fixed than would be a 5 star. If it was free than would be a 5 star but with these issues and having to pay it's 3
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Regarding speed: Go to phone settings, Apps, Navigation Pro. Tap Permission. Under Location choose ‚ÄùAllowed all the time"
And if you want to be sure the app is always on top on the watch screen: Check in the "Navigation Pro" settings on your phone if you have "Always on top" activated.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is semi-useful when used by itself - but when used in combination with other apps, something doesn't behave. For example, I have either Strava exercise or Samsung Watch workout in progress. As soon as I start a navigation session on the phone, the indicators show up on the phone and my workout capture ends. So, I would rather have my workout data capture continued and delete the navigation app so it doesn't interfere. ------------ Thanks for your reply - but my requirement is that the navigation not stop the workout data collection. I don't need the workout app to be up top - obviously the navigation needs to be on top or I can't see it - but it shouldn't stop the workout data collection.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, if you don't want to use the navigating often and the workout is more important: please deactivate "autostart" with navigation on the app settings. You can still see the navigation by opening the app on your watch from the apps menu

scraped_reviews.content: I was looking for a maps app for my samsung galaxy watch...and thought of installing this app by making payment because of the thought that paid app will more reliable. But after installing found that the app is faulty. Each time after connecting with mobile app, the app in watch gets disconnected. Got the same issue continuously. Currently started using 'here' app which is a free app and is much better than Navigation Pro app.

Make sure you understand this app is totally useless for what you probably are downloading it for, to navigate without a phone in your pocket, I suspect a lot of people missunderstood its funtion, the app works fine, but to me its a bit like buying a laptop computer that only works when your desktop is nearby, even if i was running, or kayaking, why would i bring two devices for navigating, especially when one is hardly ever water proof (the phone) and one almost always is (the watch)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. The first line of the description says "Displays Google Navigation instructions from the phone on your Samsung watch". We give our best to clearly explain the function here and in the video. If you have any more questions feel free to contact us directly through info@smartwatchstudios.com

scraped_reviews.content: The app closes the maps program on my phone if it's locked. galaxy s8+. the only time I can get through a full trip as if I leave my phone unlocked. That defeats the purpose. I tried to get a refund because of this and they asked me for screenshots. I can't take a screenshot of the issue and I can't videotape it while I'm driving. this is the first app I've ever purchased and it didn't go well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the hint with the locked display: Google Maps can be shut down by energy saving settings or task killer apps. Please look into these settings and disable any power saving apps to find out if they are the reason. Also, open "Navigation Pro" on your phone, go to settings and exclude the app from power saving. I can always refund you.

scraped_reviews.content: At first i didnt minded paying 2.99 for a navigation app to use on my watch, but having an lte watch i expected to be able to use the app while using my watch as an standalone device, i dont really see the point on having directions on the watch when i can just have them on my phone. Had to ask for refund, If fixed i wouldn't mind re-buying it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, the app is intended for cycling or motorbiking, when you can't hold the phone in your hands. The descriptions also makes it clear that it uses Google Maps from your phone. However, the app "Maps Pro" is a watch standalone navigation and might suit your needs.

scraped_reviews.content: I have had this app for over a year now and I have never had any issues with it. When I start navigating using my google map on my phone, it pops up my next turn on my watch automatically. It has proven very handy to have. I have never had an issue with it running my battery down. It always stops the app when navigation is over and pops up again when I navigate via google maps. I'm using Galaxy Active2 watch and Samsung Note 10+ phone.

This app works 100%. I used it in Samsung phone and was working good then when i shifted to OnePlus, it initially dint work but after reinstalling the app it works just fine. If you face any issue you can try below steps: Please make sure Maps notifications are activated. Open ‚ÄúNavigation Pro‚Äù on your phone, click on the 3rd link " settings-apps- maps" and allow Maps notifications. If you don‚Äôt see the 3rd link, you need to reinstall app and restart your phone.

Horrible!!! It requires the phone to be hooked up to the watch ! Totally worthless üò™ I hope they might issue a refund!! It was exactly what I DON'T NEED!! ...UPDATE ! I found a very cool stand alone app for my galaxy 4 watch! it works amazing like google maps does! maybe better? GPS Navigation by SOMYAK ? exactly what I was looking for , and was 2.49
scraped_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry you had different expectations. That's exactly what the description and screenshots show. However, the standalone Navigation "Maps Pro" might suit your needs. You get refunded automatically if you uninstall within 2 hours. It‚Äôs a testing period. Or contact us directly through info@smartwatchstudios.com so we can refund your order.

scraped_reviews.content: Almost perfect navigation app for galaxy watches. I used it on the watch 4 and now my watch 5. The only issue I have is that if you don't have Always On Display turned on for the watch, it doesn't vibrate for turns or show the navigation notification. I have to actively check the watch to get updated. This is with no battery savings mode turned on and both google maps and navigation pro set to "Unrestricted" for battery. If it gets fixed to stay on always regardless of AoD I'll set it to 5 stars

I purchased this app, and now regretting for a bizzare error. Whenever i open this app on my galaxy active 2, it always ask to connect through bluetooth. Although, watch been already connected with phone via bluetooth. I am able to receive call and make calls and other functionality through bluetooth. Update: YEs my problem has been solved and now app is working extremely good with accuracy. (upgrading to 5 stars; appreciate your prompt response)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, I'm sorry to hear! This is often related to energy saving settings or active power save mode. These settings are more complicated for Xiaomi phones. Please contact us directly through info@smartwatchstudios.com and we can refund you

scraped_reviews.content: Turns on my watch navigation when I'm in my car and runs down my watch battery. In response to the developer, as I mentioned, the settings on the ohone are not helpful. I use android auto and do not want my watch to take priority over it. I have it switched to off, but it doesn't turn it off. When I had auto start turned off I could not get maps/location to woek on the watch at all. Again.. making the app useless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Marilyn, in the Navigation pro settings on your phone, there are 2 options interesting for you: "Android Auto", switch this off if you prefer your car's navigation over the watch. Or switch off "Autostart watch app" to only use the app on demand.

scraped_reviews.content: My concern is that the display on my watch is always on, I've selected the option to dim the display but still the app ate through 15% of battery on my watch in 4hours, would have given it 5 stars if the display on my watch stays off until I look at it. The option to have voice on watch and not phone doesn't work on my Nokia 7.1 plus even though option is ticked in settings. Just a couple of things I feel would make this fantastic

Aside from one thing, this is an awesome app. The one thing: I don't understand why my phone screen MUST be on for it to give directions on my watch? Why can't the phone be standing by if the watch is utilizing the map? 5 stars if I can stop using my phone battery the whole time... For a couple hours trip, this is very taxing on the phone ... Not so much the watch app.

Overall the app is good but sucks that after a minute or so of my phone screen being locked to just use the watch to navigate, the watch will end my navigation entirely on both my watch and phone. Kind of defeats the purpose of having that app on your watch if I still have to keep my phone screen unlocked just use the GPS on the watch
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This is usually caused by energy saving settings or battery saver apps. Please look into these settings and disable any power saving mode to find out if they are the reason. Also, open 'Navigation Pro' on your phone, go to settings and exclude the app from power saving. If the problem persists you may contact us through the email link in the app

scraped_reviews.content: I don't need to open any apps on my watch... it just tells me when to turn, and when, all on its own. I love it. The customization for the interface is pretty cool too. I absolutely love that there's an option to adjust the orientation based on your grip of the steering wheel. 5/7

So nice to pair with your smart watch. automatically pulls up on watch when you start navigation without you having to do anything. "OK Google, navigate to ______" and boom up on phone and watch. Let's you lock phone screen to save battery while watch stays on shows you next turn. Vibrates when close or makes noise (your preference, silence is option also)

I installed this app 2 days ago and although it seemed to work fine the first day, it started freezing up my phone and draining the battery very fast. Whenever i unlock my phone the home screen crashes and the phone itself was heating up tremendously. I uninstalled the app today and my phone is back to normal. No crashing, heating, or draining battery. I hope a fix is found for this because otherwise I paid 4$ for nothing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, I haven't seen such a behaviour so far. What would help is when this problem is present to use the email link in the app to contact me. This way I will get a log file that shows me what the reason is. If you want a refund you may also contact me directly through this link.

scraped_reviews.content: Perfect motorcycle companion! Its pretty convenient for the car as well. Vibrations indicate an upcoming turn and you can quickly reference the street name. It seems like they keep improving it. Hands down the best app I purchased for my gear S3 Frontier. The devs are also super responsive. I suggested they make the watch dial adjust the orientation, and they implemented it pretty quickly.

title: Google Fit: Activity Tracking
description:
Get to a healthier and more active life with the new Google Fit!

It's hard to know how much or what kind of activity you need to stay healthy. That's why Google Fit collaborated with the World Health Organization (WHO) and the American Heart Association (AHA) to bring you Heart Points, an activity goal that can help improve your health.

Activities that get your heart pumping harder have tremendous health benefits for your heart and mind. You'll earn one Heart Point for each minute of moderate activity like picking up the pace when walking your dog, and double points for more intense activities like running. It takes just 30-minutes of brisk walking five days a week to reach the AHA and WHO's recommended amount of physical activity shown to reduce the risk of heart disease, improve sleep, and increase overall mental wellbeing.

Google Fit will also help you:

TRACK YOUR WORKOUTS FROM YOUR PHONE OR WATCH
Get instant insights when you exercise and see real-time stats for your runs, walks, and bike rides. Fit will use your Android phone's sensors or Wear OS by Google smartwatch's heart rate sensors to record your speed, pace, route, and more.

MONITOR YOUR GOALS
See your daily progress on your Heart Points and Steps goal. Meeting your goals all the time? Easily adjust your goals to keep challenging yourself to achieve a healthy heart and mind.

MAKE ALL YOUR MOVEMENT COUNT
If you walk, run, or bike throughout the day, your Android phone or Wear OS by Google smartwatch will automatically detect and add your activities to your Google Fit journal to ensure you get credit for every move. Want extra credit? Turn up the tempo on your walks by starting a paced walking workout and stepping to the beat. Enjoy a different type of workout? Select it from a list of activities like pilates, rowing, or spinning, and Google Fit will track all the Heart Points you earn.

CONNECT WITH YOUR FAVORITE APPS AND DEVICES
Fit can show you info from many of your favorite apps and devices to give you a holistic view of your health, so you'll never lose track of your progress. These include Lifesum, Wear OS by Google, Nike+, Runkeeper, Strava, MyFitnessPal, Basis, Sleep as Android, Withings, Xiaomi Mi bands, and more.

CHECK IN AT ANYTIME, FROM ANYWHERE
See a snapshot of your activity history across Fit and your integrated apps in the redesigned journal. Or, get the full picture in browse, where you can find all of your health and wellness data.

KEEP A FINGER ON THE PULSE OF YOUR HEALTH
Breathing is one of the simplest ways to reduce tension and relieve stress. With Fit, checking in with your breath is easy‚Äîall you need is your phone camera. As well as your respiratory rate, you can measure your heart rate to get a better understanding of your body‚Äôs wellbeing.

VIEW YOUR DAY'S STATS AT A GLANCE
Add a widget to the home screen of your Android phone or set up a tile and complication on your Wear OS by Google smartwatch.

Learn more about Google Fit and see a list of supported apps at: www.google.com/fit
