Learn more about Google Fit and see a list of supported apps at: www.google.com/fit
summary: Want to take charge of your health? Let Google Fit help you reach your goals.

scraped_reviews.content: Wish there was a way for the step counter widget to update in real time. Especially at the end of the day when I'm trying to reach my target goal. And most of the time when I open the app it still takes 30 seconds or more for it to update the count. And sometime it won't update at all. Frustratingly, sometimes the app will decrease the amount of steps or heart points that you have earned. If you are trying to maintain a streak of days where you've made your target this can be very demotivating.

I seriously loved this app. It was a great catch-all for me because I hike, cycle, and horseback ride. But now that they're discontinuing it, the whole thing is going downhill. I have no idea why they decided to kill this thing; it was reliable, easy to use, and would sync nicely will other apps. Super disappointed because all of the other fitness apps look like buggy, expensive messes. PLEASE Google I BEG YOU to keep this app alive.

It doesn't sync to anything anymore. Google Fit is now blocking apps I want to connect to and have previously connected to. Data is inaccurate because of the lack of syncing, even when shown as connectedness. If you try disconnecting and reconnecting the applications, Google Fit will deny the connection, and there is no way to override. Google Fit is Junk!

It's a good app. I use a Fossil Gen 6 and while I use both apps Fit seems to work better. I like tracking my vitals along with my activity for the day. THAT SAID... I have a backlog of data and don't like weight entry set up like an "odometer" and the calendar is also tedious. Just let me type in the data please. Even better, you folks seem hard core on us talking to our phones, why not just me tell Fit, without typing/scrolling at all? And bring back desktop support like all your other apps!

I just want to say, so far, outstanding. I have seen Fitbit charge a crazy price for their "premium" services when it's mostly the same as this app! I can manage my Fitbit data through here with the fit to fit app, though that app still needs help. This app only needs the ability to sync data between third party apps possible! Add that, and possibly a mental health section as well, since you have meditation and whatnot, why don't we add an actual journal? Or a health journal? Just an idea.

probably one of the more frustrating apps I use. I use it to connect to another app as I need it to track my steps, and the step count on it is incredibly inconsistent. like another reviewer, it'll take a while to update your steps, even going backwards at times. it's like it can't make up its mind if the steps you did count or not (I also have a pedometer to track it against, so I know it's backing out the steps for no good reason). would like to see that bug resolve.

The tracking for a sedate walk is pathetically sad and embarrassingly inaccurate. I went on a 40 minute 2km walk around a developed neighborhood and it said at the end of the session that it was only 29 minutes and 0.89 km then on the map it created a path that is literally impossible. Until they get that tracking fixed I don't recommend anyone bother with it.

Really like the fact that this app is free and works pretty well with the phone. I wish it would've transferred over old data when I got my new pixel. however the only issues I have so far: we should be able to add a different activity if one is not listed. there should be an easier way to add steps too.

App hardly tracks data, and when it does, it's still intermittent. I have attempted every fix suggested by Google and third parties (uninstalling the app, changing settings back and forth, updating app, etc.) And the app almost never tracks my activity. I started using a different app called Pedometer Step Counter and it tracks my activity accurately and reliably. 2 years later and this is still accurate. glad it's fixed.

I use it to track steps. However, there are many issues with it! It won't sync to my Galaxy Fit watch, my step counter resets to zero numerous times a day, it is supposed to link to other apps through Health Connect and it doesn't. The list of problems just keeps going. Don't try to figure out how to contact support because, as far as I have found, there isn't one.

This app used to allow me to add results from strength training, biking, etc., but that feature no longer posts the data to my daily activity chart. That's what set Google Fit apart from competing apps - it was mor than a step counter. Not sure if or why that feature is disabled, but the app holds little value to me without it. I will explore other options & likely ditch Google Fit. edit: Now Fit is subtracting steps during the day. Didn't think it could get more useless.

This app lacks some major features like the ability to edit your run data. On occasions my GPS will add a half mile to my runs because it loses signal temporarily. Google fit will not let you easily fix this. You have to delete the entire run and manually enter a new workout. I recently switched to mapmyrun and found Google fit will import that data. I was excited because I could keep my annual run total going but now if it messes up, there is no way to correct it. I can't even delete the runs!

I like the simple no nonsense interface that collates data from multiple apps and sensors without unnecessary bloat, gamification or ads. However, it's rather spoilt by random data loss and inconsistent syncing. It's annoying to watch your hard-earned heart points disappear in front of your eyes. Could be a great tool, but it feels like Google can't be bothered to sort out the long-standing bugs.

Inferior app: the mechanism to bring in data is not intuitive if trying to troubleshoot. Graph autoranging is amateur stuff - scales should not change period to period unless I want them to. Makes showing progress over time cumbersome. Sport data from Fitbit device not captured properly (kayak becomes standup paddleboard, mowimg lawn is pool laps). Lots to improve. Update: No changes since last review - shows lack of developer interest in product excellence - they just want the data.

It's improved since last review. Mostly working well. Syncs pretty well with Health Sync so I can use my Garmin. Still lose two stars for no Garmin integration. Both companies are too big to not talk. One major issue. On the sleep screen, when I click a particular day, it doesn't say the date anywhere on the screen. It's frustrating not being able to see the day when comparing stats. Thanks!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Donnie, we're sorry you've had this experience. Try clearing the cache of the Google Fit app. To get more accurate estimates, turn on location and activity tracking: https://bit.ly/3sRQrqu

scraped_reviews.content: There are so many bugs, it's completely unusable. First, I ran around a large block 3 times: Fit tracked it as a half a lap and then me teleporting through a building to get to my final location. I checked my phone just before the final lap and it said 1.25 miles, but when I ended the workout it said 0.8 miles?? Next, the weight tracking uses the absolute worst moving average curve I've ever seen. If you enter your weight 8 times in a day, the curve makes a sharp turn. That's just terrible math.

It used to track weekly miles walked. That panel has now disappeared and replaced with "Energy Expended" (calories I guess) which I don't care about. In fact I don't see any way of editing my goals anymore. There used to be a way of doing this. Maybe it's right in front of my face and I'm missing it. If I figure it out I'll edit this review.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. We're sorry to hear that! Please send us in-product feedback through the 'Profile' tab by tapping on 'Help' and then 'Send Feedback'. This will help us investigate this issue. Thanks in advance for your patience and support!

scraped_reviews.content: It's a pretty good app, I like tracking my steps and my workouts and weight all in one place and I like that it connects to other apps. However, two issues: when tracking a workout, I wish it were easier to log what workout you're doing. It gives you a drop-down menu and you have to scroll through the whhhoooolllleee thing every single time. I wish you could search your workout and save a minute between sets. Also, I wish it were easier/faster/more efficient to track water directly on the app.

Your app has changed drastically, steps, distances. Not accurate anymore at all. Been using you for well as long as I can remember. And it's just occured in the last few weeks to a month. I use it every single day. Always update it. I used to love this app, even got other people to change to it, their changing back to their old fitness app because their having the same issues. It once was a great fitness app, not so much anymore.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Glenn. Sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with activity tracking. This help article contains tips: goo.gle/2rv5ZVk. If this doesn't fix it, we'd love to hear more, so we can learn from experiences like yours and keep improving Google Fit. This can be done in-app through the 'Profile' tab by tapping on 'Help' and then 'Send Feedback'.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for about a week now, maybe 2, for tracking walking. When I stop the tracker, it tells me the distance, time, and pacing/mile is one thing. However, when I go to check the journal, all the numbers have changed and cut about a third of a mile off, resulting in time changes as well. Why is the summary one thing, but the journal entry is completely different?!

GPS is useless as it doesn't seem to start when you start or stop when you stop. It also doesn't give you even a reasonable track of your walk/run so the distance is also useless. 9/6/22 Update: I find that if I also run Map My Walk by UnderArmor, Fit immediately becomes a perfect GPS tracker and provides very accurate info. But why run two apps??!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Tom, we‚Äôd suggest enabling your Google Fit app‚Äôs permissions in its settings to improve its tracking. Also, reinstalling it might help. If it‚Äôs still the same, you could check our community forum for more troubleshooting steps: https://goo.gle/3BYDX6F

scraped_reviews.content: This is a perfectly serviceable, basic app to track distances traveled, maps of walks, runs, and rides, number steps, and other high-level information about workouts and day-to-day activities. I use it often on bike rides, walks, and runs. But when I compare it against the data that I can get from my Polar GPS running watch and its app it seems surprisingly bare bones. When I first started using it, I thought it would replace my other fitness tracker, but it's not nearly as comprehensive as I would have expected. It does what it does well, but it doesn't do as much as I would have thought.

I'm with a lot of other people. i used to really like the app but haven't found it very useful lately since the update a few months ago and stopped using it. I wanted to start using it again but can't figure out how to set goals all i see is steps, heart points? and move minutes. i want distance in a week goals like 25-30 miles per week. I'm looking for a better app.

It's ok! But something I'd like to suggest is to put a sleep tracker in the app. Sleep is very important to your overall health. This app is very basic considering it's a Google app. I also would like for the fitness tracker to take the phone it's connected to to be able to also track steps/mileage using GPS. The fitbit app is amazing and I wish this was more like that, i.e. sleep tracker, ability to add friends for accountability, challenges amongst users, earn badges, etc.

No longer pulls in data from other apps. This used to be my go-to for having all of my separate fitness data synced into one place. Over the past few months it has been unable to actually pull in any data from any fitness app. Which is really unfortunate because it was great at that. I get that the focus is on Fitbit now, but it'd be nice if this app could at least work. I have actually used Fitbit to see if it could receive data from other apps, and it does. So it's definitely an issue with Fit

App used to work great but just like everyone else it stopped working recently. The app will not count any of my steps or activities. It also no longer will allow me to sign in on my regular account and I had to log in with a different account. I've uninstalled and reinstalled and that did not work, switching accounts didn't either. I'm just trying to get an accurate pokemon go step count and without adventure sync it doesn't work, so I beg of you, please resolve this issue.

When I use this app a few years ago it worked fairly well. I've stayed on top of the updates and it just doesn't seem to track my location properly at all. I'll walk four or five miles in this app will only track a third of a mile or so. It's really frustrating, my polar beat has no issues with tracking mileage & distance, but this app seems to no longer cut it at all. Location and physical activity have been allowed for all of time, so there shouldn't be any issues there. Not pinging correctly.

Doesn't track accurately. The map doesn't sync up properly. Says I ran for 7 min when it was a 45 min brisk walk. It alwayse confuses walking and running with the times being off. Update: the link sent to me to help trouble shoot was a waste of time. I deleted the app. I hear Nike has a pretty good app. I'll be trying out other apps.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Matthew. Sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with activity tracking. This article contains some suggestions on how to fix tracking issues: https://goo.gl/YJvK2N. We hope this helps and thanks for your review.

scraped_reviews.content: It's okay for tracking activity & weight, but I question the accuracy of the step & calorie burn count. It will show 1800 calories burned, then suddenly subtract a thousand calories. Update: March 15, 2021. No longer shows steps, heart points & move minutes. I tried reinstalling. Same problem. I'd swap for a different app, but this one offers more actives than just running or cycling.

update: i have had the app for a long time and it worked fine. last update messed everything up, no tracking, not connecting, nothing. I uninstalled and installed again, but now it's not even connecting to my Google account. so long, Fit. I was mostly satisfied with the app until last upd , it has absolutely no data since May 17th! what happened??
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Elena. We're sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with your historical data. When you first connect Fit, we will import your historical data into the app. This process may take a few hours, but you'll then be able to see your historical data on all of your devices. We apologize for the inconvenience but hope this helps.

scraped_reviews.content: I've sent feedback at least 2 times in my app, under profile as you've suggested to the numerous people who have the same problem I have. I'd love some type of response. Since I have had no acknowledgment there, I'm writing my issues here. Fit is not tracking, unless I manually turn on/off tracking. This used to work automatically until December. Please address.

Overall, it does what it's supposed to. I debate the accuracy, but my one real complaint at this point is that if I am looking through the data for previous days, there is no way to see the total distance traveled that day. You can add the distance for each recorded activity set, but that's an irritating waste of my time. I would like to be able to calculate average distance per day more easily.

This app used to be better but lately it seems to be getting worse. It no longer wants to track the minutes I spend exercising. I just went on at least a 20 minute walk which even my old outdated pedometer was able to pick up . Yet Google Fit failed. Update July 8 2023 It has gotten even worse since last year. As others have said it no longer tracks activity. I walked back and forth in the house for at least 10 mins and it picked up nothing. Also as someone else said Fit is very buggy.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for leaving a review, Yohance. For best results, try reinstalling your Google Fit app then try rebooting your phone after. Also, make sure all of your Google Fit app's permissions are properly set and its location tracking is set to Allow all the time. For more help, you can visit our support page: https://goo.gle/3BQHjbG

scraped_reviews.content: I admit that I liked it's tracking, but it's such a battery killer that it's unkeepable. I went from my battery never dropping below 60% in a typical day (~16 hours) to it never being above 10% when Fit is allowed to run freely in the background like it wants. Turn only that one thing off and battery usage levels return to near-none. However, then it's unfunctionable and can no longer track. There are far too many competing apps that don't have this problem this severely. Must uninstall.

It would help if I could add distance to my workouts. I run on my elliptical for a set distance, not time. I appreciate being able to track my steps and heart rate. I should be allowed to edit the distance achieved. The same for stationary bike or treadmill. Allow us to edit the stats to add distance. Otherwise, I have to write down my stats, delete the workout, and add the entire thing all over again. And lose heart points in the process.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: HI Kimberly. We're sorry to hear that! The team is working hard to make Fit better over time. Please continue to help improve Fit by sending in-product feedback through the 'Profile' tab by tapping on 'Help' and then 'Send Feedback'. Thank you for letting us know!

scraped_reviews.content: Could be better. This serves a basic function as an activity tracking app. However, the integration of heart points and move minutes can be confusing. Less effort was put in step counting which most use it for. For added exercises I would recommend adding the typical amount of heart points and move minutes because in most cases that is impossible to know.

lots of issues on lg v20 running nougat. No kind of tracking‚Äã is working in the app, all fitness data is being imported from lg's fitness app, which I downloaded this to get away from. Would love to use this instead, but I can't even add an activity manually. It just won't save. Not sure what the issue is, but pretty disappointing. Would love to see this fixed so I could use this as my main fitness app.

I haven't been able to log into the Google Fit app in weeks because it can't verify my Google account. The last time I was able to log in, all of my previous stats were erased and it wouldn't track steps. It still works on my watch. It's ridiculous that this hasn't been fixed yet. I've already done all of the troubleshooting you have to offer. This issue is solely on Google's end.

You have officially lost a user. The last update has made a huge error in keeping track of the distance accurately. It jumps all over the place, too far in distance in a short period of time then jumps back to starting your distance when you've been at it for 20 mins. This is no longer a reliable app. Too bad you don't pay attention to your app. You can see comments explaining this app is having trouble and not running accurately, and you're not doing anything to rectify the problem.

I like that this app is so closely integrated into the Android OS and that it works well with wearables such as Wear OS. It also covers all the basics that you would expect from a fitness app (steps, active minutes, calories, heart rate, etc...) and connects well with 3rd party health apps. What it doesn't have is workout detection and sleep tracking that many of the top fitness ecosystems have.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Leigh. Thanks for taking the time to review Google Fit. To share more details directly with the Fit team, the best way is to send in-product feedback through the 'Profile' tab by tapping on 'Help' and then 'Send Feedback'. Your input helps us keep pushing towards a better experience, so thank you again!

scraped_reviews.content: It's wasn't the most accurate by itself, so it's only real use was to act as a go-between to synchronize data from my fitness watch to my diet tracking app. Well, it didn't do that consistently either, and now that they've done some sort of update or migration with Health Connect, it doesn't even serve that purpose anymore. What a waste of phone space - do not bother with this app, it's completely worthless now, and I have to seek out another app to somehow get my data to my diet tracker.

They dumbed the app down and now it sucks. Now it relies on heart points which are based solely on time. Do if I walk farther but faster I will accumulate fewer heart points than if I walk a shorter distance but walk slower and take a longer time to do so. They've also taken away stats for distance. So if I want to know the total distance I've walked in a day, week, or month it's simply not there. All in all just a terrible app now and I'm looking for another one.

They changed the app from tracking minutes exercised to tracking steps, a change I disagree with. Steps work for tracking some things, like walking and running, but they do not work for other forms of exercise, such as bicycling and things where you shouldn't be carrying a phone or other electronic equipment. Please make it possible to choose whether we want to use steps or minutes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for taking the time to review Google Fit. To share more details directly with the Fit team, the best way is to send in-product feedback through the 'Profile' tab by tapping on 'Help' and then 'Send Feedback'. Your input helps us keep pushing towards a better experience, so thank you again!

scraped_reviews.content: Could be better... Everything seems a little complicated to me. Some connections don't seem to update. The nutrition tracker should be more easy to use. Like QR codes on food packages or downloading recipes. There's so many easier apps. And yet why use this if others are easier. Exercise tracker included. It's more work than necessary, looking up EVERY activity and the calories it burns. Need to add more activity options.

Great app,really helps motivate me! My only gripe (and it's a big one) is that it's really frustrating to finish a workout (for me a run) having used the workout tracker to see that the location tracking is abyssmal. I have location and data on, and it still cannot draw my workout within any sane measures. No, I did not Cross an interstate 4 times and swim through a lake, burning 1700 calories in 20 minutes and averaging a 2 min km. Like.. Aren't there ways you can program in these sanity checks

This app is simple which I appreciate, but the GPS tracker is really inaccurate. And now they've recently changed the goals trackers and I HATE IT. Tracking my daily move minutes was much more useful to me than steps - steps don't matter if you're doing at-home workouts or if your ability to walk is limited by chronic illness! If they really wanted to include steps in the tracker, it would be better to ADD it as a third tracker than REPLACE the move minutes. Unless they fix this, I will definitely be looking for a better app.

Mostly enjoy, but now I'm confused. My account has been linked to my fitness apps since February and for some reason it no longer tracks any of them. They are synced and I updated, so now I'm looking at multiples. If this doesn't end up fixing I'll just end up getting rid of this cause it was supposed to be a catch all which is clearly not catching any.

The GPS and distance tracking is some of the worst I've ever seen. I watched my distance tonight jump from 1.5 miles to 1.2 miles, while the number of steps increased. The same walk earlier this week was tracked as .4 miles total, and 3 miles total. This makes the app virtually useless, which is a shame, because the app has some truly great features.

Really doesn't give much information about anything. I don't really care how many minutes I've moved as much as I want to know intensity, how long, if stairs were involved etc. Paired with the overestimation of distance people have mentioned doesn't help. I use it because it pairs with my meal tracking app, but according to that, Google fit overestimates calories burned as well.

I love this app. I use this and my watch for every workout. PLEASE add the ability to edit the exercise names in the Fit app on the phone. When creating an exercise name on the watch, sometimes there is a typo that needs to be fixed. Example - I entered 'Inline Dumbbell Press' on the workout watch app, and need to change it to 'Incline'. Editing the name would be very helpful!

title: Kwai - Cool Video & Social Fun
description:
üé•‚ú® WHAT IS KWAI?¬†
Kwai is a dynamic short video app that brings your creativity to life! Join a global community where you can discover, create, and share entertaining and inspirational videos. From funny clips to heartfelt moments, Kwai offers a platform for everyone to express themselves and connect with others. Whether you‚Äôre a casual viewer or a content creator, dive into endless possibilities and let your creativity shine on Kwai!

‚ô™ TikTok Style
Just like TikTok, Kwai offers an intuitive platform for users to express themselves and connect with others around the globe. Whether you're looking to entertain or be entertained like TikTok, Kwai is your go-to app for endless fun and creativity!

üßëü§ùüßë JOIN THE COMMUNITY
Find new friends and have fun with them. We have private messages. Enjoy the community and social network that has all the memes, trends and short videos that you could wish for.

üî• TRENDS AND CHALLENGES!
Find the best trends from around world with challenges, challenges, and competitions every day. Who will be the most most? Follow your favorite creators. Everything funny, fun and cool is here.

ü§π SEE WHAT YOU LIKE MOST
Choose your favorite content: Memes, Dance, Music, Humor, Blog, Beauty, Makeup, Fashion, Sports, Pets and much more. Find new friends who like the same content.¬†

‚ù§Ô∏è FOLLOW YOUR FAVORITE CREATORS
The best creators are in Kwai. Make a Duet with your favorite creator. Download and save your videos to watch them when you are offline. Share videos on other platforms such as WhatsApp, Instagram, Twitter among others.

üé¨ CREATE ORIGINAL CONTENT ON KWAI
In Kwai you can both watch and create videos. Become a creator by producing and uploading your own content to our community. These can be funny videos, music videos, or anything else you can think of. In other words, this is your space to shine and set trends, all while making extra money while having fun.

üëª THE BEST EFFECTS
Get creative and have fun. Kwai has the best magic effects to use in your short videos.

ü§£ FOR LAUGHING
Have a happy time watching short videos, memes and the most popular trends in the world. The funniest are all in Kwai. Among the videos on the social network, there are all kinds of content to entertain you.

summary: Edit viral videos, join live streams, shop trends and connect with friends.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is horrible, why is there little kids in revealing clothing? Why is there lewd content with kids? not just that, you can't even close or delete your account. This is so gross and alarming. Authorities should look into people uploading videos in this app. This is beyond concerning.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Ol√°, nossas Diretrizes da Comunidade declararam claramente qual conte√∫do n√£o √© permitido e se voc√™ encontrar qualquer conte√∫do que possa violar nossas diretrizes, por favor, contate-nos atrav√©s de customer-service@kwai.com e forne√ßa mais informa√ß√µes para nos ajudar a localizar e teremos um bom dia!

scraped_reviews.content: this is terrible, I downlouded the app only to find numerous videos of little girls and disgusting comments talking about the little girls being "yummy" and "tasty" this app needs to get checked by the authorities because this is filled with older men flirting with younger girls around the age of 6-13.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Ol√°, nossas Diretrizes da Comunidade declararam claramente qual conte√∫do n√£o √© permitido e se voc√™ encontrar qualquer conte√∫do que possa violar nossas diretrizes, por favor, contate-nos atrav√©s de customer-service@kwai.com e forne√ßa mais informa√ß√µes para nos ajudar a localizar e teremos certeza de revis√°-lo novamente.Tenha um bom dia!

scraped_reviews.content: Great app but you guys have to control how you disable people account for no good reason it money we use in subscription but you guys will just block it it's on fear

so much issue when I update my account name and everything needed, date of birth and more coming back the second time to check my bio I see it all clear. This app have a lot of issue don't install it I made a mistake to install it waste of time and data
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Ol√°, por favor envie seu problema para customer-service@kwai.com ou para o centro de ajuda no aplicativo com o assunto \'Ajuda de Google Play\' e descri√ß√£o detalhada do problema. Assim que recebermos sua resposta, iremos ajud√°-lo. Sentimos muito por essa experi√™ncia.

scraped_reviews.content: Damn.. it used to work. I took a long break from using it and tried to come back yesterday but nothing is working anymore. The for you page constantly says "can't connect to the server", I've tried updating my profile picture twice, both times saying that it's been updated successfully but nothing actually happens, my bio won't change and none of my uploads are actually uploading, but yet I'm not receiving any error messages. This looks like it's been going on for a while so Kwai probably isn't worth it at the moment. I hope this gets fixed pretty soon.

You don't receive all the time. When you play other ads like the chest and the tree, you watch ads to receive chest or double the amount of things in the tree app. But a lot of the time you don't receive them. I watched 30 segunds ads to receive a chest, but after that I didn't get any chest, it happened 6 times just today. title: Pilates Workout at Home
description: Easily lose weight at home with Pilates for weight loss. Wall Pilates workout for women beginners. Pilates, wall Pilates like Belly Exercise for Women. Join Pilates Workout at Home! Pilates is a holistic exercise system that focuses on strengthening the core and enhancing flexibility, balance, and overall body fitness. Unlike other workout apps, our free Pilates exercises effectively activate and strengthen your core muscles and other key areas like the abs, lower back, legs, butt and pelvic floor muscles, while promoting weight loss. Wall Pilates uses a wall for support and resistance. Our plan is low-impact, beginner-friendly and perfect for women's fitness needs. From belly workout to full-body toning, our wall Pilates app is every woman's top choice. Ready? Let's go! Practicing Pilates has many benefits for health & weight loss. Similar to yoga, our Pilates exercises for Android like Xiaomi/Huawei can not only help weight loss, enhance muscle strength, and improve balance/flexibility, but can also enhance energy, promote relaxation, and even improve sleep quality. üåü Strengthen muscles Pilates as a kind of weight loss exercise is highly effective in strengthening core and deep muscles in the abdomen, lower back, and pelvis, promoting overall body toning. üåü Lose weight effectively With just a 30-day Pilates weight loss plan, you can transform your body into a more toned figure. Pilates is an effective weight loss tool for those looking to shed excess pounds. This low-impact Pilates exercise for Samsung, Redmi, Motorola, Xiaomi/Huawei users engages multiple muscle groups simultaneously, effectively boosting weight loss results. üåü Enhance flexibility Worried about your body being too stiff? Through its gentle yet effective movements, Pilates gradually lengthens and stretches muscles, increasing flexibility and range of motion, leaving the body more supple and agile. üåü Improve posture & relieve pain By strengthening muscles and promoting alignment, Pilates effectively addresses poor posture, making you look more upright and elegant. Moreover, it can effectively relieve shoulder, neck, and back pain caused by poor posture, helping you lose weight with less burden. üåü Boost energy Pilates boosts energy by metabolizing stress hormones, relaxing muscles, accelerating weight loss, and incorporating specialized breathing exercises that enhance circulation throughout the body. Extraordinary experience prepared by Pilates Workout at Home: ¬∑ Personalized weight loss plan just for you Tailored plans for weight loss designed exclusively for any fitness journey. Join! ¬∑ Focus on your target areas Targeted exercises for abs, chest, buttocks, legs, arms, and the full body. ¬∑ Suitable for all levels Various plans and workouts for Android like Xiaomi/Huawei cater to both beginners and experienced enthusiasts. ¬∑ No equipment needed Whether at home, at work, or outdoors, you can practice Pilates anytime, anywhere, all just with one workout app for Android. ¬∑ Expert-designed plans and workouts Ensuring the highest quality and effectiveness in your Pilates routine, including science-based weight loss tips. ¬∑ Various workouts to meet all your needs Meet all your fitness needs like weight loss or pain relief, allowing you to choose routines that align with your preferences. ¬∑ Detailed video instructions Guiding you through each exercise, ensuring proper form and technique. ¬∑ Smart progress tracker Helping to visualize your fitness journey and progress, keeping you motivated. ¬∑ Daily reminders Keeping you on track, making it easy to maintain a consistent Pilates routine. Take a few minutes each day for self-care, immerse yourself in the world of Pilates! With our Pilates Workout at Home for Android, your body will become leaner, more toned, and healthier, while you'll also experience a more joyful state of mind. Download now!

scraped_reviews.content: Great app especially for FREE. The music is relaxing. I only wish I could play my own during the workout I love the countdown and halfway point features so I don't have to jump back and forth to my phone timer. Most exercise apps don't give you a rest between each exercise. But this one also has the option to skip it each time. I also love that it is a quick wrap-up when done, no having to check off each exercise individually at any time.

This is not free. The same basic plan is, I had someone with totally different goals and measurements do it and it gave her the same workout. Anything other than the most basic one you have to pay for YouTube has a lot of free videos better than this. And it will start out with something like "100" or mountain climber then save the stretching for the end not very efficient

Usually I can't keep up and the moves are silly On this app the moves were straight to the point and effective I've been bed/ chair bound for 10 years. UPDATE 10/25 -- STILLL WITH THIS APP & ABSOLUTELY ADORE + RECOMMEND!!! --side note:: bought pd vs.// mehhhh :-/ ...could be more to explore....somewherrrre ..?... but most folks should be just as well free vs. // JUST 'X' OUT of PAY SCREEN!!! And side, side note-- i usually do @3 sets @ a time to be better work amount. .ENJOY!!üêû so far, free version, and its one out of the many, many apps i've downloaded, that I've actually used and stuck with. 2 weeks now! HIGH RECOMMEND !!!! üêû

I've had the app for over a year. The only workout I used to do before was taking out the trash. Going into this app as a starting point was a struggle. Their program just doesn't prep you enough for impactful exercises. What worked best for me was starting with a 5k running app. When I could run for about 10min I went into this app. I could actually perform the exercises that made a difference instead of wasting my time on simple ones. I recommend core and wall challenges.

I really like this app, but it can improve: being able to favorite workouts so you don't have to go searching through the menus. Being able to switch out exercises for similar ones in case you don't understand how to do them safely (Pigeon pose confuses me). The "feedback" box in the app made 0 sense as it wanted to send the review through a secondary app? There's no way to edit any of your responses from the initial download questionnaire, making it obvious that data doesn't actually get used.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We're sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction, but we're grateful for your valuable feedback. Our goal is to make exercise both enjoyable and effective, and your suggestions are very helpful. We'll work on enhancing these features in future updates. Thank you for helping us improve! Best regards. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: On the free version. I really love it. Great workouts that I can easily do at home. Great narration, both visually and audibly. So far, no ads. Love that I don't have to exit out of those, like in other apps. I do with that it would tell me audibly when I am done with the workout. I keep going until I look at the screen and it shows I am done. That would be a really easy nice feature to update it with.

This app is abrupt and no frills. easy to use. there are only 2 choices for music and they sound very similar so you don't waste time with settings. Timings are varied per workout. You can manipulate workouts if you need to. Lots of choices on free side but there's a pay side too I haven't tried that yet, I want to see how committed I am. before I spend money on another program

downloaded it because a few reviews said it's free, its not. its free to download and go through all the questions but its not free to use the exercises like others you have to pay for a weekly, monthly, or yearly plan. *edit* the "x" to get out of the plans portion was blended into the picture in the top left, so plans are not required to start. thank you for getting back so quickly to address the issue
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Niagania! Please note that the basic version of our app is 100% free. You can click the "X" button to exit the purchase page and enjoy great 30-day workouts for different fitness levels on the "Plan" page without any payment. If you find it helpful, please consider giving us more stars! Best regards. üíó

scraped_reviews.content: DON'T DO IT! This app offers a 7 day free trial and then you have to pay for a subscription. It says if you cancel BEFORE the 7th day (making it LESS than a 7 day trail), you won't be charged. They make it next to impossible to do! There's no way to do it in app or ANY contact info. NOW, I get a response after leaving a bad review, ON THE DAY I'm charged $84. How convenient. I sent 2 msg in the app well BEFORE the trial end & NO Response. It's now cancelled. REFUND MY MONEY!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello KayDee. Sorry for your dissatisfaction. Please note that we were unable to locate your email in our backend system. Additionally, we have already provided instructions for unsubscribing in the comments. Any further questions, please contact us via "Me -> Settings -> Feedback" in the app and include relevant screenshots. Best regards. üåπ

scraped_reviews.content: I like how personalized this app is, being able to select if it was too hard, too easy, or just right. The first time I tried this app, I stopped after 21 days. A year later, I started over, making it through the first 30 days. then making it through days 31-40 which were somewhat challenging. I intended to repeat days 31-40. New phone, lost my saved progress... So, I updated my goals and current circumstances to start over. I'm 55 and finally feel like I can stick with it.

I've been using this app every day for over a week and really like it. I do Pilates about once a week in a studio, but I wanted to add more shorter sessions throughout the week. Doing the 30-day beginner challenge has been motivating, and it's so easy to get it done with the workouts being 10 minutes or less. I currently use the free version, which has no ads. I would recommend to anyone who's a beginner, or like me, wants to increase their activity level bit by bit.

Actually use this app daily. it allows importing music from my phone for a playlist of music I actually like, that starts automatically with the workout. has daily reminders, customizable workouts, and I'm already noticing an improvement for posture, balance, and gains on weight machines at the gym thanks to a more solid core. I recommend!

I selected the 30 day subscription but was subscribed to the 3 month subscription without my consent. I subscribed to the 30 day subscription and was charged for and subscribed to the 3 month instead. I have contacted the app developer and Google play and they refuse to help me. This app is an absolute rip off and the support is non-existent. Save yourself a headache and download the free app instead. This app promises a lot but is not even real Pilates but just warm up stretching.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Trudy, we apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered. Our application strictly follows the subscription plan selected and will not adjust options without explicit consent. Additionally, your insight will definitely be taken into account as we refine our workout design in future updates. Thanks for helping us improve. üåπ

scraped_reviews.content: workouts are simple and easy, app is easy to set up for personalization. HOWEVER I got a free 7 day trial, or was SUPPOSE TO get one to try it out, but I still ended up getting charged for the full year subscription and that's b.s.!! to respond to the developer comment: it would've been nice to know that beforehand!! üò§
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Sorry for your dissatisfaction. The 7-day free trial is only for full-price annual subscriptions; it doesn't apply to discounted payments. Open the Google Play app, go to "Payments and subscriptions", select your subscription and tap "Cancel". Once you cancel auto-renewal, your account will not be charged for the next subscription cycle. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: SCAM!!! Pop up said I would get a 7 day free trial, it's not true. Got charged immediately. Emailed them, was only then told I can't get a refund because the 7 day free trial only works with the full price yearly subscription! Well that's funny because the pop up said NOTHING about 'only available on full price year subscription'. All it said was '7 day free trial! Subscribe now!'- along those lines. So, be careful with apps like these, because they love to scam people! :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! To cancel your subscription to prevent further charges, please open the Google Play app, go to "Payments & subscriptions," select your subscription, and tap "Cancel subscription." Kindly note that the current subscription period has started, so you will have access to all premium content and features until it ends. Best regards. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: Based on some of the reviews, I downloaded the app and went through the questionnaire, thinking that the app and exercises were free... only to be hit with pricing plans at the end. So I guess the reviews are not to be believed or there needs to be more clarity, aka, maybe the exercises are free and the app needs to make that clear while trying to upsell people to a plan. Inauthenticity like this makes me walk away.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Sorry for your dissatisfaction. Our premium version provides access to numerous courses, but our basic version is 100% free and you can click the "x" to leave the purchase page. This allows you to enjoy 30-day workouts on the "Plan" page without any cost. We hope you like it! Best regards. üåπ

scraped_reviews.content: This company charged my card for $89 before I could cancel the 7 day subscription. The oldest trick in the book. No warning or reminder. And there is absolutely zero contact information on the app. It was literally 1 day after the 7 day free trial. Beware!! I have no way of getting this app off my card. *** I can cancel my subscription but it's for 1 yr so basically I have to wait a year and be forced to pay ahead. so canceling now does me no good. it will cancel June 2 2026
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Charges occur only if you voluntarily start a subscription or trial. Per Google's policy, you'll be charged if you don't cancel 24 hours before the trial ends. To cancel, open Google Play, go to "Payments and Subscriptions," select your subscription, and tap "Cancel." This stops auto-renewal, preventing charges for the next cycle. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: easy to navigate exercises are tailored to fit my needs not too hard. im a beginner and all the exercises for me daily are just my level. Doesn't push you harder than it needs to. I feel if it did I would give up so I appreciate the app working at my pace. I just pray it has me down to 185 by Christmas like it predicted! Great app definitely worth the money I recommend it to everybody! I have the paid version. Thank you!

This app starts off pretty easy with gentle stretching & motions. It graduates to poses that engage your muscles more . This is not as easy as phase 1 but not difficult either. Unfortunately, by day 11, that ends. It is a huge disconnect. There are moves which are quite a bit more difficult, with little direction. It felt like some got skipped. Also, it asks if you have knee issues, then proceeds to give you lunges. It all seems promising, but that fades fast.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Sorry for your dissatisfaction. Your feedback has been noted and we will look into some improvements in workout arrangements when planning future updates to bring you a better workout experience. For any other questions or ideas, please contact us via "Me -> Settings -> Feedback" in the app. Best regards. üåπ

scraped_reviews.content: There is a free version first off but I actually really love the app and paid like $20 or so... maybe 29.99 for 6 months to get the results I want. I think that's a great deal but I'd like to figure out how I can put the app on the tv.. cast or even an app or cast button compatible with the tv or xbox. I can't find the app when I search on those types of devices. Help pls I do love the results I've been seeing! I can feel and see it! Working out all the right muscles Ive been seeking to tone!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Shemiah! Glad to receive your support and valuable feedback. Currently, we are not able to cast on TV or provide compatible versions for TV devices. We'll consider adding related features when planning future updates to meet your needs. Thanks again for your input and enjoy your fitness journey!‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: Great app, but I feel it needs to start on advanced for some people. It might have that, and I didn't see it or accidentally missed it, idk. Just in case though If you're a more advanced, active, limber & stronger person, might I suggest that you start on the 7th or 10th day instead of the 1st. That way, you bypass all the exercises that you normally wouldn't do or need. Had I not been able to do that, I would never have purchased the subscription due to it being way too easy thought it a scam.

I love that this app has very clear instructions, and they actually show you what you need to do, slowly, before you do it. They have a clock going and peaceful music that doesn't bother me at all, for each exercise. I like that they ask you after the workout if it was too hard, just right, or too easy, and can alter the workouts going fwd to suit where you are at. I LOVE that the workouts are only 9-10 minutes and yet you feel stronger from them. I have greater flexibility when I do this often.

The free version is honestly quite good. I didn't except it. Easy to follow workouts that focus on strength, endurance, weight loss & fllexibility. The version you pay for is probably better BUT the free version has what you need to accomplish your goal. To get the free version I had to hit cancel when it asked for payment. Declined it almost 10 times until it loaded the free version. Kept offering a lower price so if you DO want to pay then hit cancel at least once or twice for a better price

Just downloaded, so can't rate on the exercise, but I wanted to say: To avoid getting shoehorned into a subscription, when you get to that page, you have to take to decline option. It feels like you're taking the choice that will make the app useless, because they really set it up like you have to subscribe, but the decline option gets you to the free version.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Emily! Thanks for sharing your comment. We will take your feedback seriously and consider making some improvements in this part. If you have any other questions or suggestions during use, please feel free to contact us via "Me -> Settings -> Feedback" in the app. We are always happy to hear from you! Best regards.‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: Love this app! It really helps u find which level is best for you to start on based on current mobility/lack of mobility and past knowledge of exercises. It starts off slow for beginners so u aren't overwhelmed and just want to quit right away. It makes it easy, yet you still feel the wonderful "burn of progress" the next day. It's such a good pain, knowing your body is getting stronger and more fit!!! You know it's working!

I'm on day 4 and it keeps trying to get me to subscribe. I exit out of the option and I can not progress past. I'm disappointed, I downloaded based on the good reviews and having to use it for free. It's not the case for me. Apparently if you refuse the 7 day trial you don't get that option again and you are stuck behind a paywall. Edit - I've done what was suggested, but the the subscription page keeps popping up. Everytime I press the start button I am unable to get past the paywall. :(

scraped_reviews.content: This app was falsely advertised. It is not free. Only 7 days free. 19.99 a monthly or you may get a discount at 69.99 for the year. They have other deals on a spin -wheel, but that's by chance. As much as I wanted this app, I just don't know. They may be writing there on reviews because multiple said free. Updated review. I did the deal for the year at a lower price. I wanted the wall pilates. In just a few days, I fill the inches. But I also go to the gym 5 times a week as well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Sorry for your dissatisfaction. scraped_reviews.content: I've been trying to find an actual free Pilates workout app, and this wasn't it. All of the other reviews must be fake because it only gives you a 7-day free trial, not even enough time to see results. I couldn't find anywhere in the app store stating there were in-app purchases like it usually does with other apps, so my hopes were high, especially because of the reviews, only to be let down.

scraped_reviews.content: Love it! I wanted to do pilates when I can't go to the gym. I'm also a beginner so the steps and videos with timers helps a lot. I will probably get the paid version soon. For now this version is great to learn and start out. I'm so glad I didn't opt for the more expensive plans out there. This is totally worth it. Not over done, simple and easy to follow. Makes it more likely 4 me to keep going ‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è

I recently had surgery, and I have been having a difficult time adjusting. Between the depression and being inactive, it just isn't me. This app is affordable (I've also been out of work), and it allows you customized workouts in bite-sized pieces. I also enjoy that there are other modules I can take on if I'm feeling up to it that day, but if not, the daily 10min workouts make me feel accomplished and keep me moving.

One of the best free apps I have ever downloaded. I'm 12 days in on the workout and I can definitely feel a little stronger and can see some increased body toning. It provides a nice challenging workout in about 15 minutes for someone who either can't get out to a gym or doesn't have the time to commit much more. I like that it combines some stretching with some medium to challenging exercises. The example video is so helpful to ensure you are doing the exercises properly.

So far I am enjoying the app, but not for $80/yr. Reason for the three stars is in regards to it being advertised as free. When I got to the purchase page, couldn't find how you are supposed to get this for free so assumed from other reviews that you had to go ahead and purchase it, then there was something after purchase that allows you to change it to free for the basic plan. Didn't happen... Contacted support and you have to x out of the purchase page for free plan. That's sneaky & deceptive.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Sorry for any inconvenience. We have received your valuable feedback and will consider optimizing the layout and instructions on our purchase page in the future. We are committed to providing you with more convenient and efficient service. Thank you for your attention and support for our product. Best regards. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: I downloaded this app because several reviews said it was great and free. It's not free at all, it's a free trial and then $80/yr. Beyond that, the sessions in the "custom" plan are all less than 10 minutes long and they're really only stretches, but with no warm up or anything first to prep your muscles for the stretch. Horrible program. Not worth it. And they've charged me for TWO separate subscriptions. Same subscriptions, but shown to start on two different dates. For the same app. SCAM!!

scraped_reviews.content: So far, it's good. Like that they are short exercises, much needed for busy moms or any busy person who needs to get some exercise in their day. I don't like that it was tricky when it said we would get a free 7 day trial, but in reality, that wasn't true. I guess later I read in another review that the 7 day trial wasn't for the ones that get a discount of 29.99. That was the bummer. I just hope I do see results since I kinda got tricked into buying the subscription.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Stick with our app to see the benefits. Best regards. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: the app itself is good as well as the workouts as much as I've done. but when I paid to actually look at the app and see what they had and how it worked to compare to the free one I currently use they stated there would be a 1 week trial. which did not happen! they charge right away and you are not able to cancel that! so I guess make sure this is exactly what you want and will use before you 'try it out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! The 7-day free trial is exclusive to full-price annual subscriptions; it is not available with discounts or monthly plans. Open the Google Play app, go to "Payments and subscriptions", select the subscription and click "Cancel". Once you cancel auto-renewal, your account will not be charged for the next subscription cycle. Best regards. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: I read the reviews. said it was free with in app purchases. Not true.The minute I opened the app, it wanted payment. It immediately wanted to set a plan and then payment. I couldn't even look around to see what was offered first! I deleted right away. Will not use or recommend! **Note to editor:There wasn't an "x" button to exit. It insisted I fill out my info and didn't give me a way out. I looked!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Erika! Please note that the basic version of our app is 100% free. You can click the "X" button to exit the purchase page and enjoy great 30-day workouts for different fitness levels on the "Plan" page without any payment. If you find it helpful, please consider giving us more stars! Best regards. üíó

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for a little over a month now, and I have absolutely loved this FREE app. I'm just barely overweight, but consistent exercise always left me feeling extremely sore and had me going long stretches between exercise sessions. Being a busy mom, and working, I also never felt like I had the time for it. This app has shorter sessions, that's still make me feel good afterwards and it's very doable. I'm starting to see the difference and I'm feeling a lot stronger now. Love it!

The app said it had a 7 day free trial and then would charge my card. I exited out because I didn't want a monthly charge. Well I got charged the 19.99 plus tax anyway. Never even got the 7 day free trial. I want my money back since I exited out of the app and didn't authorize the charge. But now I can't find a customer service number or contact info anywhere. I have requested a refund through Google. Let's see if that works.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Kymber, sorry for the inconvenience. We follow Google‚Äôs policies and always aim to offer the best service. Our support team has received your feedback and is currently verifying it. Please be patient as we work on this. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation! Best regards. ‚ù§Ô∏è

scraped_reviews.content: I'm really enjoying this Pilates app, and I highly recommend it! I originally thought it was free based on other reviews, but I ended up subscribing to the pro version for $35/year. It's well worth it. I love that you can import your own music, and it's very easy to follow along with the instructor. Besides your basic plan, there are many other challenges and routines you can do. The goal tracker is nice to have also. It's a very well-done and high-quality app!

UPDATE: I've been using this app for 5 months now & I still like it. It has helped me tone, lengthen & become stronger. 2 things I don't like are length time of an exercise is more than it actually is. If time mngmnt is important, double it. Secondly it gives you a lot of exercises in a row that use the same body parts causing strain, ie: weight on your wrists or tension in your neck. Overall, I have been very pleased and would add another star for attention to these two concerns.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thanks for your rating! The duration displayed on the course page reflects the "net workout time," which does not include rest periods. Also, your valuable feedback has been noted and we'll consider your suggestion as we work on improving the workout design in future updates to enhance your experience. Thanks for helping us improve! üíó

scraped_reviews.content: so, I've used it or over two months at this point and I've come to hate it. the first 20 days were okay but I've pretty much stopped at day 57 as I'm barely completing the exercises and end up skipping most of them. it's way too hard and the app pretends to customize your workouts based on things like goals and injuries, however it certainly doesn't based on what I've been getting. it even asks how to workout went at the end but nothing changes based on what you say. not beginner friendly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We apologize for any disappointment you've experienced. We aim to make exercising effective and your suggestion really makes sense. We will look into optimizing the workout arrangements when planning future updates to bring you a better experience. Thanks again for your input. Best regards. üåπ

scraped_reviews.content: I've already recommended this app to my sister and daughter. I didn't think "10-minute workouts" would do anything, but I've woken up with something slightly sore everyday this week. There are many routines and challenges to try at various experience levels. I can customize the duration of an exercise and my rests in between. I love the countdown and announcement of being halfway through an exercise. I also appreciate being able to see someone perform the exercises. Worth it!

I've had a break from this app due to a few recent surgeries, but this is honestly the best at home workout app that I have used. Not saying others aren't just as good, but this is by far my favorite üëåüèº Pilates is such a great low impact strength training for someone like me that has limited mobility/use of my lower extremity. And I can adjust my rest time and the amount of time I want to "hold" or "continue" the exercises.

I've only started using the app. But I enjoy the music they play with the stretches and exercises. They explain the moves your doing and allow you to skip or add more rest time in between, I think that's nice. I'm not paying for anything, and still so far, I feel it's a nice way to star to get in to exercise and stretching. I'm doing the 30 day challenge, easy enough to try for 30 days and see results!

been using this app for a few months now. I can totally feel the burn after a session. I love that they have different fitness levels (beginner, intermediate and advanced). another thing I love is the sessions are short, 15-20 minutes and you're done. perfect for my busy schedule. I also incorporate simple stretches and quick workout from the app throughout the day.

This app gently challenges one in daily 15 minute increments and there is a rest period between each exercise. I am out of shape, with 20 pounds to lose, and feel that this is the perfect app, because the daily workouts are challenging enough, but brief in comparison to taking a class. Because the daily workouts are brief, one can do them in the morning & at night and look forward to feeling exercised without being exhausted. My heartfelt thanks to the creators of this app.

I really love this app, however, there is one big thing that would make it 5 stars. There are some exercises that people can't do. For example, a lot of the exercises that require using my knees. Some I cannot do, it would be nice if there were some alternative exercises to do. (knee plank, box push ups are just a couple examples) I did put that I have knee issues when I downloaded the app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Amanda! Sorry for your dissatisfaction. Our mission is to ensure effective workouts, and your feedback is valuable to us. We are committed to improving our app, and your insight will definitely be taken into account as we refine our workout design in future updates. Thank you for helping us improve. Kind regards.üíó

scraped_reviews.content: To my knowledge, everything about this app is behind a pay wall. Obviously the personalized workout plans, but the regular workouts are all behind a pay wall, as well. That is extremely frustrating. I have other apps on my phone that have tried the personalized workout plan thing first before they give you access to their generic workouts, but the difference is I can actually do those workouts, either completely for free, or I have to watch an ad before I can do it. Not true for this app.

This allows you to enjoy 30-day workouts on the "Plan" page without any cost. We hope you like it! Best regards. üåπ

title: Prodigy Math: Kids Game

Prodigy delivers a unique learning experience through an interactive math game where success depends on correctly answering skill-building math questions. Players can earn rewards, go on quests and play with friends ‚Äî all while learning new skills! 

We know that every student faces unique challenges when it comes to math learning. That‚Äôs why: 
‚Ä¢ Content is tailored to every player‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses 
‚Ä¢ Math questions are fully aligned with state-level curricula, including Common Core and TEKS, so Prodigy is always connected to the classroom. 
‚Ä¢ 1,400 available skills give students the chance to learn more and keep growing. 

For a full list of the skills Prodigy supports, visit prodigygame.com/math/skills. 

Are you a parent? Connect a free parent account today to:
